Senior Consultant

Company Name HIP V. HYPE Sustainability Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 39 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Role: Senior Consultant/ Engineer Better Buildings - FULL TIME\xa0

Location: 330 Park Street Collective - Carlton North
Starting: OCT 2018


Purpose:\xa0

Apply excellent technical skills, project management skills and analytical frameworks to support the Better Buildings team design-led advice and action, to drive effective and ambitious integration of environmental, social and economic sustainability in the built environment.


Work across nationally significant residential, mixed-use, education, commercial and precinct-scale projects, leading in the provision of technical analysis, modelling, research and sustainable design advice.


Play an active role in the continual improvement of the quality of analysis and advice provided by our team, maintaining our continued pursuit of genuine impact and positive change within the built environment.


Actively develop and maintain collaborative relationships across the industry, and through these explore and create opportunities to deliver meaningful work with a network of clients and collaborators with aligned values.

Experience and Attributes:\xa0

_ Deep alignment with our values and an active interest in design and sustainability is essential.
_ A relevant qualification in Engineering, Sustainable Design or a related discipline is essential.
_ An established network of industry collaborators.
_ Strong technical skills and knowledge in energy and daylight modelling, passive design, water sensitive design, sustainable servicing strategies, materials, IEQ and embodied emissions is essential.
_ Strong knowledge of local building codes and standards. _ Strong software capability such as IES, Energy Plus and
FirstRate5.
_ Industry accreditations such as Green Star, OPL, LBC.

_ Great written and verbal communication skills, financial literacy and a strong capacity to understand and work effectively within the commercial parameters of project delivery.
_ Ability to think logically, analyse and assess opportunities and risks and identify solutions and outcomes.
_ A strong understanding of design thinking principles and ability to understand and adopt a design-led approach to problem solving and project management.
_ Ability to identify opportunities to continuously improve our processes and practices.

Tasks:\xa0

PROJECT LEADERSHIP
_ Operate with support from the Better Buildings Lead and Managing Director to lead multiple projects and client relationships, and manage delivery by other team members including Graduate Consultants.


TECHNICAL ANALYSIS & SPECIFICATION
_ With direction, take a leading role in the delivery of research, analysis and specification across all aspects of high performance buildings including: thermal comfort analysis, daylight modelling, shading studies, Life Cycle Assessment, and key sustainability measures (thermal fabric, building and precinct-scale energy, water, waste, transport).
_ Manage the delivery of BCA Section J (including NatHERS) compliance and certification processes including Green Star, WELL, One Planet Living and Living Building Challenge.
_ Oversee and provide quality assurance review of technical analysis and documentation completed by junior team members.


COMMUNICATION OF ADVICE
_ Report drafting including preparation of Sustainability Management Plans, Sustainable Design Assessment reports and Section J Compliance reports.
_ Contribute to client presentations and workshop facilitation.

_ Lead in providing timely and accurate advice to clients throughout the planning, design, construction and operation of their assets.


ORGANISATIONAL DEVELOPMENT
_ Support collaboration across HIP V. HYPE’s Four Pillars.
_ Support and mentor junior team members with guidance from Better Buildings Lead and Managing Director.
_ Assist in the development and refinement of delivery processes and tools.


OPPORTUNITY DEVELOPMENT & INDUSTRY PARTICIPATION
_ Create and sustain productive relationships with clients and collaborators with aligned business values.
_ Lead proposal drafting, project budgeting and resource planning.
_ Represent HIP V. HYPE Sustainability through participation in industry events.

IT Operations Officer

Company Name Crown Resorts Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 180 views

Job description

IT Operations Officer
CROWN MELBOURNE


Ranked among the top 20 most valuable brands in Australia, Crown Resorts is one of Australia’s most iconic tourist destinations and an employer of choice. Crown wholly owns and operates two of Australia’s leading integrated resorts - Crown Melbourne and Crown Perth.

Working alongside the Senior IT Operations Officer, the Operations Support Officer is responsible for maintaining ongoing availability of the Crown production computer environment. As the successful candidate you will be working 12 hour shifts on a continuous roster basis: 4 days on 4 days off. Shifts are 0700 – 1900 and 1900 – 0700 hours ensuring the provision of customer focused, timely and cost effective support for applications, user hardware and infrastructure across the Crown business.


Some responsibilities of the role will include, but are not limited to:

  • Ensuring maximum availability of production applications by providing timely and effective support, including taking remedial action, marshaling support resources and communicating with stakeholders
  • Participate in the delivery of IT projects
  • Processing data backups and restorations in line with the shift task list and procedures
  • Providing desktop support to meet customer requirements and operational service level commitments
  • Ensuring all incidents occurring during the shift are recorded promptly and accurately to reflect status
  • Completing shift documentation in a comprehensive, timely and accurate manner
  • Assisting with scheduled hardware rollouts and the execution of current and future projects to ensure they meet time, cost and functionality objective

What you need:

  • Tertiary qualification in Information Technology or a similar discipline is highly desirable
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Operational support experience is highly desirable
  • Demonstrated experience providing exceptional customer service
  • The ability to work independently and as a team player
  • Holder of a Victorian Commission for Gambling Regulation (VCGLR) Category B license or ability to obtain
  • Ability and commitment to work 12 hour shifts according to a 24/7 rotating roster

We offer you the opportunity to work within a large and talented team within a superior and vibrant brand. If you want to be part of the experience that only Crown can offer, and have the required skills and qualifications, then please submit your resume and cover letter by logging into Crown Careers, with your Crown employee login.

Applications close Wednesday 26th of September, 2018.

As part of Crown’s workplace inclusion and diversity strategy, we strongly encourage applications across all cultural backgrounds, genders and abilities.

Principal Competition - Legal

Company Name BHP Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success.

About The Role

The Principal Competition - Legal supports the asset and business legal teams across Minerals Australia and our global functions in relation to the design, maintenance and implementation of our Competition Compliance Framework. In this role, you will be responsible for the provision and procurement of competition law-related legal advice, preparation and maintenance of training materials, and participation in investigations and litigation with competition law aspects. Reporting to the Vice President Legal Regulatory & Disputes, you will be accountable for supporting the asset and business legal teams across Minerals Australia and our global functions in relation to the following:
  • Identification of emerging competition law risk (including through participation in risk assessments);
  • Design and maintenance of the Competition Compliance Framework (including Our Requirements);
  • Provision and procurement of competition legal advice and guidance on behalf of our Businesses and Functions, including in relation to the review of transactions, management of risk, contractual protections and embedding and implementation of competition law compliance policies and procedures;
  • Preparation and maintenance of training, communications and guidance materials and the delivery of tailored competition law training to relevant teams within the Business and Functions;Research on competition law-related issues;
  • Conduct of investigations;
  • Monitoring of developments in competition law across jurisdictions worldwide and assist with the identification and execution of improvements to the Competition Compliance Framework and associated systems as necessary;
  • Share competition law knowhow with Legal and other relevant stakeholders;
  • Assist with compilation of relevant data and information for the purposes of internal reporting.

About You

To be successful in this role, you will ideally have the following skills and experience:
  • Tertiary qualifications in law
  • Entitlement to practice in Australia
  • Strong experience of Australian competition law in private practice
  • Exposure to competition laws of jurisdictions other than Australia
  • Experience in the energy and resources sector, including JV arrangements
  • Experience within a relevant government agency
  • General corporate/commercial practice experience
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work autonomously but also to work effectively within a team.

Supporting a diverse workforce

At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from women and Indigenous people. We know there are many aspects of our employees’ lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms. #LIGF

  • Oil & Energy

Job description


About the company:


This Australian leading retailer has an extensive footprint with stores throughout Australia, New Zealand and Asia, experiencing substantial growth over the past 18 months. With offerings across the online and retail channel, they are committed to delivering the best quality products, superior service, price and expertise. They are looking for a Lifecycle Campaign Manager, who will oversee the lifecycle program, creating an industry leading program that generates customer love and business growth.


About the role

In this newly created role you will be working closely with and reporting to the Customer Marketing Manager, contributing to lifecycle strategy development through developing targeting strategies, customer journey mapping, inbound lead management, setting key success measures, and reviewing and optimising campaigns. You will identify and address opportunities for marketing automation to improve lead qualification, customer acquisition and retention, lead-to-conversion ratios, revenue pipeline and customer lifetime value. This role involves stakeholder management across the business to ensure the fastest speed to market, and to coordinate clear communications throughout the course of the campaign.


Key responsibilities include:

  • Design marketing programs based on customer marketing strategy to delivery 1:1 communication across channels
  • Mange the end to end development of customer lifecycle campaigns, including briefing of creative, data delivery and results across all channels
  • Build test and learn framework for loyalty and customer lifecycle initiatives
  • Develop a strategic road map for the regulatory changes that are segmented and personalised.
  • Lead improvements of all email marketing campaign effectiveness, through send planning, segmentation, content weightings, test planning, innovation EDM design and engaging content
  • Manage and execute all member communications material and communications activities across email/mail and digital member channels;
  • Develop with key stakeholders the end-to-end member journey maps to minimise member churn
  • Help identify key audiences and segments for ongoing nurturing to be transitioned into BAU.


Skills & Experience

  • Experience in lifecycle marketing and marketing automation design and set up
  • Proven success in developing marketing lifecycle campaigns
  • 3-5 years' experience working within a campaign driven role
  • Experience working within a National Retail organisation and in a similar role
  • Excellent communication and relationship building skills
  • Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects at the same time
  • Problem solving and conflict resolution abilities
  • Relevant tertiary qualification preferred
  • Have a "can do" attitude


Culture


With incentive programs and access to a range of reward programs and discounts on stores and services, you'll join a vibrant culture and a business that values its employee's and the work they do.


How to apply


Should this opportunity be of interest to you click on the APPLY button or contact Carolyn Heyward on (03) 8613 3505 for a confidential discussion.

Talent & Wellbeing Advisor

Company Name Good Shepherd Microfinance Company Location Level 11, 350 Queen Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 84 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

• \xa0 Do you love to search for talent and on-board superstars?

• \xa0 Does the employee experience mean the world to you?

• \xa0 Join our stellar P&C team and help support our out-of-this-world organization!

\xa0

Join a high performing team with heart!

Good Shepherd Microfinance is a world leader in financial inclusion products, services and advisory. We offer fair and affordable financial programs to people on low incomes and advisory services for governments, businesses and other organisations. Our purpose is to enable economic wellbeing for people on low incomes, especially women and girls.

\xa0

What will be your key focus?

The People & Culture Team partners with all teams across Good Shepherd Microfinance and works closely with all managers. This role has been created in response to the growth and development of our work. Reporting to the People & Culture Manager, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing the recruitment and on boarding of talented and skilled employees to enable our strategic goals; lead a review of safety practices across all parts of the organization and coordinate and support other aspects of the employee life-cycle for our high performing team with heart.

\xa0

What will you need to succeed?

  • Tertiary qualifications in human resources
  • Demonstrated success providing in-house recruitment/talent acquisition services
  • Highly articulate with well-developed verbal and written communication skills and the capacity to influence
  • Attention to detail and the ability to perform work to a high standard of excellence
  • Demonstrated success in planning and implementing projects, experience working on safety and wellbeing projects preferred
  • The capacity and commitment to work in alignment with the values of Good Shepherd Microfinance

\xa0

More about us?

Our People & Culture Team (currently 2!) are a small, energetic band of problem-solvers. Playful, hard-working and passionate about all things people, are just a few of the ways they describe themselves. Oh and there’s coffee, lots of coffee.


At the core of our team are our values and a culture that invests strongly in professional development, workplace flexibility and employee wellbeing. In 2016, we were ranked in the top 10 most innovative not-for-profits in Australia and our work is growing! Our team has nearly doubled over the last couple of years and we’re proud that women make up 66% of management and to have team engagement scores that are some of the highest nationally. In addition, our remuneration includes generous salary packaging benefits that can increase take home pay.

\xa0

Interested? To learn more about us and to download the position description, visit www.goodshepherdmicrofinance.org.au/careers For further information and queries, contact Jo Caruso, People & Culture Manager at jcaruso@gsmicrofinance.org.au or on 0425 755 602.


To apply send your resume and a cover letter to: careers@gsmicrofinance.org.au. Your cover letter should tell us why you want to work with us, why you see yourself in this role and how you believe you meet the criteria outlined in the points above (also in the Position Description).

Please note: There is no closing date for applications but please apply as soon as possible as applications will be shortlisted as they are received.

\xa0

We recognise the rich diversity of people across Australia. We are committed to ensuring that our team is reflective of the diverse community we serve and to supporting a culture of equity, inclusion and diversity.

The Gruyere gold deposit in Western Australia is one of Australia’s most exciting new gold projects. Gold Road Resources and Gold Fields are proud to have an established 50/50 JV partnership over Gruyere. With Gold Fields as the JV manager, the team at Gruyere have hit the ground running and are working hard to achieve first gold production in 2019.

Role Details

Reporting to the Commercial Manager, you will be responsible for all financial matters in relation to Gruyere Mine. You shall be regarded as a cost leader and have a dynamic approach to overseeing the day to day affairs as a back to back to the Commercial Manager. The Commercial portfolio is responsible for; Finance and Planning; Supply Warehouse; Camp & Flights and IT. The candidate will also be a dedicated business analyst and have direct end of month accounting responsibilities across the site.

This role is offered on 8 days on and 6 days off and is Fly In Fly Out from Perth. Flexibility around this roster will be required initially, details of which will be discussed with applicants who progress to the interview stage.

Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Always act in a manner that seeks to enhance the strong safety culture and performance of Gold Fields and ensures that the Vital Behaviours program is supported and strengthened.
  • Oversee day to day aspects of the Commercial department when the Commercial Manager is not on site. This includes IT, Flights, Supply, Village management, and site finance and business analysis.
  • Coordination, preparation and analysis for budgeting and forecasting, also including continuous improvement of analytical reporting models and forecasting tools.
  • Dedicated commercial support to operations where a high level of technical business analysis is required to drive business improvements.
  • Key resource in supporting the Commercial Manager in coordinating the annual LOM strategic business plan with detailed quality business analytics.
  • Contract supervision of Camp services contractor monthly KPI's and managing day to day issues as they arise in partnership with the Site Administration.
  • Contribute to company and statutory compliance obligations ensuring Sarbanes Oxley standards are met through the generation of quality reports through the input of physicals on a regular basis as directed.


Key Factors To Your Success Include
  • Bachelor of Commerce; Accounting or recognised Tertiary Qualifications.
  • Diploma in Front Line Management is an asset.
  • Experience in JV Accounting would be advantageous.
  • A CPA or CA Qualification would be highly regarded.
  • 8 years' experience in a financial role within a mining environment, previous supervisory experience would be highly desirable.
  • Advanced Microsoft skills and computer literacy.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of ERP systems – SAP and Xeras Experience would be advantageous.
